quiz.q: Which of the following circumstances always require paper entry
Where is the normal place to look for the Aircraft Log Book
Prior to initiating any cockpit procedures...
The inbound ARD is to remain in the logbook
a: Until a neew valid ARD is printed...

quiz.q: When an AMT signs or initials an aircraft maintenance document...
All paper Aircraft Maintenance Log pages must be retained with the stations copy of the ARD and retained for
AML errors can be corrected by erasing, scratching out...
A full review of the logbook for missing AML pages is required only when
a: An aircraft is on the ground 2 hours or more and maintenance is performed on the A/C resulting in an updated eMR or printed ARD

quiz.q: When maintenance personnel perform EAML data entry of a discrepancy
What is used by the AMT to document aircraft maintenance
a: Aircraft Maintenance Log or Electronic Aircraft Maintenance Log
